modules.description: This module implements a binormal model for precision-recall curve analysis using a mixture of two Gaussian distributions. It provides functions to create and estimate model parameters, simulate datasets, compute the precision-recall curve explicitly, and calculate the area under the curve (AUC). The model is particularly useful for evaluating binary classifiers under varying class distributions and decision thresholds.

This module evaluates binary classifiers by constructing precision-recall curves and computing AUC using trapezoidal integration and average precision. It supports analysis under varying thresholds, with confidence intervals calculated via logit or bootstrap methods, and includes a binormal model for explicit curve generation and simulation under different class distributions. Direct operations include calculating operating points, AUC, and confidence bounds, while the child module enables parametric modeling with Gaussian mixtures for deeper analysis. Examples include comparing classifier performance across datasets or simulating PR behavior under class imbalance.
